segments.text: It's kind of heartbreaking seeing the woman so lost in her routine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's drying that plate so meticulously, unaware of the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet is growing, but her face stays blank.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those poor kids are up to mischief, but it feels lonely somehow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy stretches so far on that stool, desperate for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waits patiently, her little hand raised in hope.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they'll get caught or if it'll all go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight from the window highlights the ordinary sadness of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden blooms peacefully, contrasting this indoor neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She might ruin the floor or cabinets without even knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookies in the jar seem like a small joy in this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me feel a bit down, seeing potential trouble ignored.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would notice and make it right.
segments.speaker: PAR
